page.title: 07PLACE NAMES 5
page.content: { North Gill Wood :}A gill is the Norse word for a ravine or glen. Thus the meaning of North Gill Wood is 'the wood in the in the north ravine'. {Osmon Flat :}The old Norse name 'Osmundr', is probably that of a settler who owned much land around Cotherstone as the name occurs frequently in area. This is obviously the flat piece ofland belonging to Osmundr. {Raygill :}The word 'gill' means a ravine or glen but the first element is rather obscure. It has been called Foxgill but this is not a certain interpretation. It could be related to deer in some way as in Raydale the 'Ro' is Old English for roebuck. {Reahope}in Weardale is derived from 'Rea' which is Gaelic for rapid. This is like the Welsh 'Rhe' meaning swift which is the origin of many placename
